FOUND IN: Sea turtle - A group of reptiles that live in the ocean and have some features reminiscent of a tortoise but lack overall resemblance.
Feudalism - a socio-economic system prevalent in medieval Europe, based on land ownership and service to lords or monarchs.
Faucet - An apparatus allowing water to flow intermittently through small openings; commonly found indoors and associated with kitchens and bathrooms.
Larva - The larval stage in a holometabolous insect's life cycle (complete metamorphosis), characterized by significant growth and feeding before pupation or transformation into an adult.
Associate lady (formal reference within professional settings)
Egg cell - The female reproductive cell in oviparous (egg-laying) animals, also known as an ovum or oocyte before fertilization occurs.
Alpha - The first letter in both uppercase and lowercase forms, used as a symbol for beginning or primary elements.
Filigree - intricate and delicate metalwork in twisted threads or fine patterns, often used as decorative elements on jewelry or furniture.
